intro: Lamyra pinnatifida, commonly known as the broadleaf lamyra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves, which are often broad and have a leathery texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Lamyra pinnatifida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
